content: p l y m o u t h y a r n® f355 d e s i g n s t u d i o f r e e w i t h y a r n p u r c h a s e angora baby beret to fit newborn 3 6 9 months approx circumference 12 14 16 18 materials angora 2 10gballs color 711 blue gauge 5 sts = 1 in st st on size 8 knitting needles needles us size 6 & 8 double points stitch marker pattern is written for smallest size with larger sizes in parenthesis if one number is given it applies to all sizes with size 6 double points cast on 60 70 80 90 sts join in the round being careful not to twist place stitch marker workin 1x1 ribbing for 7 rounds switch to size 8 knitting needles and st st knit 2 rounds increase round 1 *k6 7 8 9 m1 repeat from * 70 80 90 100 sts knit 3 rounds increase round 2 *k7 8 9 10 m1 repeat from * 80 90 100 110 sts work in st st for 1 ½ decrease round 1 *k3 k2tog repeat from * 64 72 80 88 sts knit 3 rounds decrease round 2 *k2 k2tog repeat from * 48 54 60 66 sts knit 3 rounds decrease round 3 *k1 k2tog repeat from * 32 36 40 44 sts knit 3 rounds decrease round 4 *k2tog repeat from * 16 18 20 22 sts decrease round 5 *k2tog repeat from * 8 9 10 11 sts decrease round 6 k0 1 0 1 *k2tog repeat from * 4 5 5 6 sts work 1 ½ icord on these sts cut yarn draw through remaining sts pull tightly knot the icord if desired weave in all ends ©2011 plymouth yarn company 032111vle abbreviations bobble=bind off c6f= slip 3 sts to cable needle and hold to front k3 k3 from cable needle decrease = decrease increase = increase k = knit psso= pass slip_stitch over p = purl rs= right side sl = slip ssk = slip 1 st as if to knit slip a second st as if to knit knit them together through the back loop st s = stitch es st st = stockinette st tbl = through back loop decrease = together ws = wrong side yo = yarn over wyif = with yarn in front wyib = with yarn in back
